Title: Data Analyst
Company: Delphi-US, LLC - Peacemakers in the Talent War
Description:
Title: Data Analyst/Operations Associate (Contract) - Job#5067




Location: Boston, MA




Job Description:

Our client located in Boston, MA has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst/ Operations Associate to join their team. This resource will have data management systems experience, a command of Excel, and intellectual curiosity. This position requires an individual who is exceedingly detail-oriented and organized who possesses a determination for accuracy and has the ability to navigate complex databases.




Responsibilities

Maintain the integrity of the Raiser’s Edge/NXT database specifically for Opportunities, Actions, and Notes with some monitoring of InfoEd.
Monitor the LOI, Planned, Pending, Awarded, Declined, and Withdrawn Gift and Grant Opportunity records within the Raiser’s Edge/NXT and InfoEd databases for FR and CP teams.
Review all opportunities submitted by officers to ensure accuracy.
Retrieve and document notices of grant agreements and grant contracts; upload to corresponding Opportunity record in NXT database.
Enter, review, monitor, and assess Action records weekly in order to ensure timely response to foundation deadlines and reporting: Send related reminders to FR and CP team members; track past due and upcoming gift/grant reports, distribute to FR and CP team, and update NXT as appropriate.
Working with Prospect Development and Research Team, create pending future Action records for foundations determined viable through prospecting.
Reconcile NXT Opportunity and Gift records with projections on a monthly basis to ensure accuracy of each Pending, Awarded, Declined gift/grant submission.
Actively identify and pursue opportunities to improve FR and CP operations by troubleshooting, resolving issues, and leading data cleanup projects.
Manage, coordinate, and maintain the integrity of filing systems; ensure proposal attachments and other frequently needed data are current, e.g. patient demographics, audited financials, board lists, letters of recommendation, etc.
Anticipate and provide timely response to FR, CP, Operations, and Development requests for information, service, and assistance.
Use Asana gift forms to enter upcoming gifts and grants into NXT record.
Schedule and track payments, future payments, create invoices, pledge reminders, draft acknowledgements, and other stewardship activity and outlined in gift/grant agreements and MOUs.




Required

Bachelor’s degree required
Two years of experience focused on data analytics, process implementation and improvements in a nonprofit or for-profit field
Knowledge of fundraising procedures and processes is preferred
Demonstrated ability to take complex data outputs and synthesize into understandable reports
Familiarity with CRM and CRM-related applications and database operations, preferably with those used in development. Experience with Raiser's Edge, Raiser's Edge NXT, and/or InfoEd preferred
Mastery of Excel, the creation and utilization of pivot tables
Proficient with PowerPoint or the equivalent software
Ability to manage multiple tasks in a deadline-driven environment
Proven track record with attention to detail, precision, multi-tasking, and problem-solving
Strong written communications skills
Superior interpersonal, communication and customer service skills
Discretion in handling sensitive and confidential information




About Delphi-US

Delphi-US is a national recruiting firm based in Newport, Rhode Island. We specialize in IT, Engineering and Professional Staffing services for premier corporations and a multitude of industries across the United States. We are the Peacemakers In The Talent War – bringing the best and brightest talent to Employers of Choice, enabling critical project success, fostering progressive employment relationships, and promoting competitive advantages for our Clients and the Talent Marketplace we serve. Delphi accomplishes this with a proprietary skill-based and cultural matching process that results in higher qualified submissions along with increased interviews and offer rates. You’ll find our team is highly experienced, friendly, professional and ready to advocate on your behalf, armed with industry trends, and an understanding of employer expectations.

Title: Data Analyst, CMC Data Science
Description:
The Role

In this role, you will be part of a vibrant team responsible for providing data science and analytics support for GMP and Development Production operations at our Norwood site and global partners. You will contribute to process data centric activities which support the Operations, Quality, Manufacturing Science and Technology, and Technical Development organizations including data centralization and the development of statistical analysis, reporting, and visualization tools.

Moderna is a global company utilizing both internal manufacturing and external commercial manufacturing organizations (CMOs). This requires integration and contextualization of data from diverse sources. Moderna utilizes a digital infrastructure for both GMP and non-GMP operations including MES electronic batch records, Delta V for process control, OSI PI as a process historian, SAP for materials control, and LIMS for analytical data, as well as internal applications and manual data sources.

Here’s What You’ll Do


Represent the CMC data science organization by partnering with Clinical manufacturing operations to support process data driven products and business processes
Enable the successful implementation of new process analytics tools through cross-functional collaboration focused on requirements, design, and maintenance
Build and utilize operational and investigational tools to support manufacturing and development operations such as statistical process control and multivariate analysis systems
Support manufacturing investigations, operational excellence initiatives, and ad hoc data needs through advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization
Direct and support various data pipeline activities including source data engineering, data intake, data contextualization systems, and validation
Set, maintain, and model best data analytics and statistical practices to drive consistency across the CMC organization
Additional duties as may be assigned from time to time



Here’s What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)


BS in a quantitative or scientific discipline (e.g. engineering, mathematics, statistics, computer science) with 2-4+ years of relevant data science/analytics experience in the pharmaceutical industry or MS with 0-2+ years relevant experience
Proficient user of statistical programs to perform DOE analyses, multivariate analysis, and apply statistical process control techniques
Experienced with computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) and statistical software packages (JMP, Statistica, Minitab, etc.) to manipulate and analyze data
Experienced with business informatics tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Spotfire)



Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table (Preferred Qualifications)


Advanced education or certification in data science or data analytics
Ability to apply strong verbal and written communication skills in a dynamic, cross-functional matrix environment
Prior experience working in a GMP environment and understanding of bioprocessing unit operations
A desire to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.



Moderna is pleased to provide you and your family with a comprehensive and innovative suite of benefits, including:


Highly competitive and inclusive medical, dental and vision coverage options
Flexible Spending Accounts for medical expenses and dependent care expenses
Lifestyle Spending Account funds to help you engage in personal enrichment and self-care activities
Family care benefits, including subsidized back-up care options and on-demand tutoring
Free premium access to fitness, nutrition, and mindfulness classes
Exclusive preferred pricing on Peloton fitness equipment
Adoption and family-planning benefits
Dedicated care coordination support for our LGBTQ+ community
Generous paid time off, including:
Vacation, sick time and holidays
Volunteer time to participate within your community
Discretionary year-end shutdown
Paid sabbatical after 5 years; every 3 years thereafter
Generous Paid Leave offerings, including 18 weeks of 100% paid parental leave for all new parents
401k match and Financial Planning tools
Moderna-paid Life, LTD and STD insurance coverages, as well as voluntary benefit options
Complimentary concierge service including home services research, travel booking, and entertainment requests
Free parking or subsidized commuter passes
Location-specific perks and extras!



About Moderna

Since our founding in 2010, we have aspired to build the leading mRNA technology platform, the infrastructure to reimagine how medicines are created and delivered, and a world-class team. We believe in giving our people a platform to change medicine and an opportunity to change the world.

By living our mission, values, and mindsets every day, our people are the driving force behind our scientific progress and our culture. Together, we are creating a culture of belonging and building an organization that cares deeply for our patients, our employees, the environment, and our communities.

We are proud to have been recognized as a Science Magazine Top Biopharma Employer, a Fast Company Best Workplace for Innovators, and a Great Place to Work in the U.S.

As we build our company, we have always believed an in-person culture is critical to our success. Moderna champions the significant benefits of in-office collaboration by embracing a 70/30 work model. This 70% in-office structure helps to foster a culture rich in innovation, teamwork, and direct mentorship. Join us in shaping a world where every interaction is an opportunity to learn, contribute and make a meaningful impact.

If you want to make a difference and join a team that is changing the future of medicine, we invite you to visit modernatx.com/careers to learn more about our current opportunities.

Moderna is a smoke-free, alcohol-free and drug-free work environment.

Moderna is a place where everyone can grow. If you meet the Basic Qualifications for the role and you would be excited to contribute to our mission every day, please apply!

Moderna is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.

Moderna is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person's race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, ancestry or citizenship, ethnicity, disability, military or protected veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital or familial status, or any other personal characteristic protected under applicable law. Moderna is an E-Verify Employer in the United States. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Belonging, Inclusion, and Diversity are critical to the success of our company and our impact on society. We’re focused on attracting, retaining, developing, and advancing our employees and believe that by cultivating diverse experiences, backgrounds, and ideas, we can provide an environment where every employee is able to contribute their best.

Moderna is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to qualified job applicants with disabilities. Any applicant requiring an accommodation in connection with the hiring process and/or to perform the essential functions of the position for which the applicant has applied should contact the Accommodations team at leavesandaccommodations@modernatx.com. (EEO/AAP Employer)

  • 401k match and Financial Planning tools
  • Moderna-paid Life, LTD and STD insurance coverages, as well as voluntary benefit options
  • Complimentary concierge service including home services research, travel booking, and entertainment requests
  • Free parking or subsidized commuter passes
  • Location-specific perks and extras!


About Moderna

Since our founding in 2010, we have aspired to build the leading mRNA technology platform, the infrastructure to reimagine how medicines are created and delivered, and a world-class team. We believe in giving our people a platform to change medicine and an opportunity to change the world.

By living our mission, values, and mindsets every day, our people are the driving force behind our scientific progress and our culture. Together, we are creating a culture of belonging and building an organization that cares deeply for our patients, our employees, the environment, and our communities.

We are proud to have been recognized as a Science Magazine Top Biopharma Employer, a Fast Company Best Workplace for Innovators, and a Great Place to Work in the U.S.

As we build our company, we have always believed an in-person culture is critical to our success. Moderna champions the significant benefits of in-office collaboration by embracing a 70/30 work model. This 70% in-office structure helps to foster a culture rich in innovation, teamwork, and direct mentorship. Join us in shaping a world where every interaction is an opportunity to learn, contribute and make a meaningful impact.

If you want to make a difference and join a team that is changing the future of medicine, we invite you to visit modernatx.com/careers to learn more about our current opportunities.

Moderna is a smoke-free, alcohol-free and drug-free work environment.

Moderna is a place where everyone can grow. If you meet the Basic Qualifications for the role and you would be excited to contribute to our mission every day, please apply!

Moderna is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.

Moderna is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person's race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, ancestry or citizenship, ethnicity, disability, military or protected veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital or familial status, or any other personal characteristic protected under applicable law. Moderna is an E-Verify Employer in the United States. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Belonging, Inclusion, and Diversity are critical to the success of our company and our impact on society. We’re focused on attracting, retaining, developing, and advancing our employees and believe that by cultivating diverse experiences, backgrounds, and ideas, we can provide an environment where every employee is able to contribute their best.

Moderna is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to qualified job applicants with disabilities. Any applicant requiring an accommodation in connection with the hiring process and/or to perform the essential functions of the position for which the applicant has applied should contact the Accommodations team at leavesandaccommodations@modernatx.com. (EEO/AAP Employer)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
W2 only - no 3rd party candidates - inquiries for this role




Duration - 6-12 months Contract to hire

Location - onsite in Andover, MA




Senior Data Analyst (5+ years of experience) - Data Science, Python, SQL, ML, Modeling




Job/Project Details:

• Mine, manipulate, and analyze data from multiple internal and external sources, reporting

key actionable insights using statistical rigor to inform the larger organization of noteworthy

trends that impact the business.

• Develop metrics, and automated dashboards to give visibility into key measures of logistics performance and provide deep dive analyses on their movements.

• Partner with the Product, Finance, Logistics, Clinical, and Tech teams to gather requirements,

create reporting and drive analytics projects that help solve complex logistics challenges.

• Constantly investigate and support implementation of new optimization, AI and ML techniques to provide tactical and strategic solutions to address the evolving Transplant Logistics needs.

• Support the ongoing design of the NOP logistics network topology, estimate resource needs, resource assignments, schedule optimization, and operational cost and efficiency improvements.




Must Haves:

Advanced SQL Skills
Python
Machine Learning
Regression Modeling




Preferences:

Tableau OR Power BI
Bachelors/master's Preferred

Title: Data Analyst | $100,000 - $130,000 | SaaS FinTech | No sponsorship offered | Onsite in Boston, MA
Company: Harmonic Finance Inc ™ | Certified B Corp
Description:
Data Analyst | $100,000 - $130,000 | SaaS FinTech | No sponsorship offered | Onsite in Boston, MA




We are excited to partner with a hyper-growth, PE-backed SaaS scaleup that is poised to revolutionize how health professionals can track, manage, and communicate with their patients. The platform provides data, insights, and tools that they need to keep their focus on delivering top-tier care for their patients.




Backed by some of the most reputable PE firms in the country, this business currently boasts a headcount of 200 and revenues close to $80m ARR.




With a passion for empowering rehab therapy professionals and improving patient outcomes, the business is poised for its next phase of growth. As the company expands its impact, they are seeking a Data Analyst to join their finance team are seeking a dynamic and driven individual.




The company’s commitment to innovation, customer success, and making a meaningful difference in FinTech offers a compelling opportunity for professionals looking to make a real impact in the industry.




The Role

Reporting into the VP of Finance, as a Data Analyst you will be comfortable working on your own and be confident to deliver findings to senior members of staff, making suggestion and recommendations to the business. You will be able to run queries in SQL database and confidential spot trends and opportunities, helping the company make proactive decisions that maximize revenue.




Responsibilities:

Distinguish between real movements in ARR vs billing issues and normalize as needed.
Where recurring billing / Salesforce issues exist, surface trends for correction.
Identify trends in downsell / churn by segment, product family and type.
Identify trends in upsell / new logo and provide feedback to sales.
Own and analyze Logo and Dollar-based retention company wide, breaking out by segment, product and service type.
Create and analyze cohort-based view of bookings and retention#
In addition to billings-based ARR cube, work through data issues to create bookings-based ARR cube for more leading-edge analysis.
Create true bookings-to-billings waterfall and integrate with backlog reporting.
Create and maintain RCM revenue forecast.
Maintain and analyze RCM capacity and productivity model.
Perform price increase data analytics work.
Support advanced GTM analytics requiring SQL (conversation and win rates by create date cohort and product)
Fuse KPIs into management dashboard and keep updated in real-time.
Run queries on SQL database




What you need:

2+ years’ experience
Strong querying skills
SaaS experience
SQL experience
Excellent communication skills for effective stakeholder engagement




What we’d like to see:

FinTech sector experience
Previous experience in a PE-backed business




Salary: $100,000 - $130,000

Location: Boston, MA




Benefits:

Unlimited PTO
6% 401(k)
Hybrid working
Full healthcare covered




If you are interested about this exceptional opportunity, please connect with Sean for further details. If you are a Data Analyst seeking a pivotal role in a dynamic, inclusive, and purpose-driven organization, we invite you to reach out. To apply or to explore more about this exciting role, please contact us at sean.obrien@harmonicfinance.com or call us at +1 (617) 861-2564 .




Feel free to share this remarkable opportunity with your network of friends and contacts who may be interested in shaping the future of the SaaS space.




At Harmonic, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and equitable workplace. We actively welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and assure you that every candidate will be thoughtfully considered for the roles we represent, without regard to race, religion, gender expression, disability, or sexual orientation.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Image Processing
Description:
LifeCanvas Technologies is an MIT spinoff venture aiming to revolutionize the way we see and study biological systems to elevate human health. LifeCanvas offers cutting-edge technologies and end-to-end solutions that enable holistic molecular imaging of biological systems to accelerate the pace of breakthrough discoveries in science and the development of new therapeutic strategies. We are based in Cambridge, MA.




Why is this the right opportunity for you?

LifeCanvas is a fast-growing, well-funded startup with game-changing technologies whose mission is to lead the paradigm shift in 3D spatial molecular mapping to elevate human health. The venture is generating revenue and profit fueled by the rapid adoption of our revolutionary products and services in key markets. Join early and make an immediate impact on building and shaping the future of a company developing novel tools for the improvement of human health. We value the autonomy, responsibility, and well-being of our team members who define the DNA of LifeCanvas. Come join a team that is pushing the boundaries of science and technology to illuminate life in 3D like never before. If you are looking for something more from your job like a bigger problem to solve with immediate and long-term impact and a mission to believe in every day, come join us.

There will be ample opportunities to be promoted to a senior role based on your performance. You will also be working with world-class researchers in both academia and industry on Bioengineering, Drug Discovery, Oncology, and Neuroscience projects across the nation and beyond.







What You Will Be Doing:

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be part of the data analytics team, focusing on the analysis of 3D fluorescence microscopy images of biological tissues. You will support our internal Contract Research team and collaborate with a global customer base of world-class scientists in bioengineering, neuroscience, and related fields to help them quantify and present their results.




Key Responsibilities:

Assist in the development and implementation of image processing algorithms for 3D fluorescence microscopy images.
Optimize and maintain components of the image analysis pipeline (SmartAnalytics).
Run and troubleshoot analyses for Contract Research data to ensure timely and high-quality completion of projects.
Juggle multiple tasks efficiently while maintaining attention to detail.
Communicate effectively with customers and other teams at LCT to ensure smooth project execution.







Our Ideal Candidate Will Have:

A bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., computer science, biostatistics, electrical engineering, bioengineering, computational biology, or related area) or equivalent experience.
Some experience with image processing for biological/biomedical applications.
Proficiency in Python for data science and image processing (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-image, OpenCV, pandas).
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to optimize code for speed and efficiency.
Strong interest in working in a fast-growing life sciences startup environment.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with customers and cross-functional teams.




Preferred but Not Required:

Familiarity with brain structures and immunohistochemistry.
Familiarity with best practices for software development (version control, file management, organization).




If you are a motivated individual with a passion for analytics and a desire to contribute to cutting-edge research, we encourage you to apply.




Why LifeCanvas Tech?

Medical, dental, & vision insurance
Flexible time off
401k match
Snacks, coffee, and plenty of office lunches

Show more

Title: Category Insights Analyst
Description:
About The Wellness Pet Company

The Wellness Pet Company crafts and produces premium natural pet food, treats, dental chews, and supplements. We believe that natural, premium nutrition focused on proven health outcomes is the foundation of creating mutual wellbeing for pets and their families. As a community of people, Wellies are positively obsessed with how to win for pets and their parents. We believe in the difference we make every single day, and we know that when we work collaboratively, Wellies are unstoppable -- Not only in providing the best nutrition to pets, but in building a better tomorrow for pets, their parents, and the world. When you join Wellness Pet, you join a team whose aligned values and purpose create a unique and exciting place to work every day. Join us on our adventure to fulfill a life of wellbeing together with pets and their parents.

What You’ll Accomplish

Our Category Insights Analyst will be responsible for leading category-wide consumer analytics within the brand marketing team. Partnering with a team of channel-focused Sales Analysts and collaborating cross-functionally with various departments, this individual will play a crucial role in shaping sales strategies, optimizing business performance, and driving growth through data-driven insights. They will be a key business partner that provides deep category knowledge working with internal and external stakeholders, driving insights and actionable plans. They will also partner with our Sales Analysts to leverage shopper insights to deliver strategic alignment and drive execution across the omni-channel shopping environment. Reporting to the Director of Consumer Insights, our Analyst will source insights from revenue & POS data, as well as primary and secondary market research sources. In addition, their role will include:


Category Level Analytics Leadership: Be the go-to source and subject matter expert across channels, at the category level. Directly support brand team to enable growth of each key business focus area.
Data Expert: Subject matter expertise in all things Nielsen including Point of Sale, and panel analysis. Utilize multiple data sources, such as syndicated (IE Nielsen) and customer-provided consumption data, for analysis and trend identification.
Business Intelligence: Convert sales information into actionable business intelligence that will drive revenue and profit for the team.
Consumer and Customer Trends: Analyze and validate consumption and point-of-sale data to ensure an understanding of current consumer and customer trends and to inform marketing and sales strategies.
Business Unit Analysis: Analyze business unit performance, including sales/share, forecasting, pricing analysis and elasticities, content audits, and digital shelf performance to enable the optimization of commercial strategies.
Post-Promotional Analysis: Conduct post-promotional analysis (ROI, Cost to Acquire, Lifetime Value) and share the findings with the sales and marketing organization in order to improve future promotional efforts.
Data Liaison: Management and maintenance of data sources and vendor relationships
Market Intelligence: Communicate crucial market, trade, and competitive information in a timely manner.
Reporting: Develop and support weekly standard reporting and ad hoc analytical needs of brand marketing team leveraging a suite of analytical tools.


Who We’re Looking For

Team Wellie is a group of people who are truly obsessed with all the best ways of winning for the consumer and the pets they love. And so, we are seeking an individual who:


Is consumer focused on all they do
Continually challenge themselves to go the extra mile to get the job done, and ensure it’s done the right way as opposed to the easy way
Hold themselves and others accountable
Embraces continual development through the sharing of feedback and investment in learning opportunities.
Is a true collaborator, sharing resources, and engages in healthy debate
Celebrates differences and strives to learn from others who are different from themselves
Gives back to their community and supports sustainable practices


In addition, for this specific role, we need someone who possesses:


Bachelor’s degree in business, or a related degree
5+ years of experience in an analyst role, ideally in a sales or marketing capacity in CPG
Extensive experience with syndicated data: IRI, Nielsen, as well as customer-provided point of sale (POS) data
Strong leadership, analytical, and communication skills, working with a variety of internal and external stakeholders to drive results
Pricing experience and subject matter expertise
Successful experience managing and ensuring compatibility of large data sets across multiple platforms
Demonstrated ability to translate financial and syndicated data into forward-looking action plans
Proven ability to perform sales ROI analyses
Expert-level skills using Microsoft Excel, Power BI (or like system)
Well-organized and able to manage multiple competing and shifting priorities and deadlines
Sees challenges as opportunities
Always displays a professional attitude


Why Work for Wellness Pet

We care about the wellbeing of our people, their families, and their pets. We treat every Wellie to a comprehensive benefits package full of extras to support their health, pets, passions, and Professional Development. More information about our benefits can be found on our website.

The Wellness Pet Company is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.


Show more

Title: Data and Reports Analyst
Description:
Handel and Haydn Society | Data & Reporting Analyst

Description

The Data & Reporting Analyst works under the close direction of the Chief Operating Officer and has moderate understanding of four core functions 1) data system administration, 2) data collection and monitoring, 3) data analysis and reporting, 4) data development and inquiry support. The Data & Reporting Analyst will support all departments in the organization.

Reports to: Chief Operating Officer

Responsibilities

Data System Administration


Conduct frequent data migration, manipulation, merging of large, complex data sets from a variety of sources
Develop and facilitate trainings on data systems for staff
Manage users and security. Enhance security groups and assign access rights to ensure confidentiality and system integrity.
Research, plan, and troubleshoot Tessitura upgrades, including leading planning for use of new features, creating testing plans, and staff training as necessary.
Manage and maintain internal and external data systems and provide technical assistance as needed
Manage the iWave donor research integration and train staff on utilizing the software as well as the custom screen and output sets available in Tessitura. On an annual basis, pull screening lists and execute screening updates.
Manage for data requests and technical support


Data Collection and Monitoring


Review and validate data entry across all data systems to ensure data entry is accurate, effective, and efficient
Develop and manage data collection processes and validation practices and procedures
Support in creating and use of data monitoring tools such as dashboards, flowcharts, presentation decks


Data Analysis and Reporting


Produce weekly and monthly outcome and performance indicator dashboards and weekly enrollment reports
Support program directors with completing outcome reports including reports for funders, internal reviews, and marketing materials
Assist with developing data visualizations and presentations for internal and external audiences, including graphs, tables, dashboards, etc. drawing on programmatic and secondary data sources
Support in the implementation, administration, and analysis of various evaluation tools such as surveys, focus groups, assessments


Date Development and Inquiry Support


Identify and support in gathering data sources, calculating baseline, setting targets, and benchmarks aligned to grant requirements
Provide coaching to program staff on the understanding of data reports and progress to meet goals
Support programming to develop a cycle of improvement through data coaching
Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


Degree in management information systems, finance, econometrics, statistics, or similar.
Minimum three years development experience or equivalent experience
Strong knowledge of Tessitura and database software
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Impeccable organizational and time management skills
Superior attention to detail
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
Ability to successfully interact with diverse groups of people
Creativity and flexibility
Professionalism in all settings
Display initiative and excellent judgment
Knowledge of classical music preferred
Ability to work occasional nights and weekends as required for concerts and events


H+H respects every individual's unique journey through life and will welcome personal statements which can deepen our understanding of any candidate's qualifying experiences. An equivalent combination of education and experience may satisfy these minimum qualifications. We appreciate all interest in this opportunity and look forward to responding to candidates whose experience most closely aligns with this position description.

Salary: $70000 - $80000 per year

HTML:
Handel and Haydn Society | Data & Reporting Analyst

Description

The Data & Reporting Analyst works under the close direction of the Chief Operating Officer and has moderate understanding of four core functions 1) data system administration, 2) data collection and monitoring, 3) data analysis and reporting, 4) data development and inquiry support. The Data & Reporting Analyst will support all departments in the organization.

Reports to: Chief Operating Officer

Responsibilities

Data System Administration

  • Conduct frequent data migration, manipulation, merging of large, complex data sets from a variety of sources
  • Develop and facilitate trainings on data systems for staff
  • Manage users and security. Enhance security groups and assign access rights to ensure confidentiality and system integrity.
  • Research, plan, and troubleshoot Tessitura upgrades, including leading planning for use of new features, creating testing plans, and staff training as necessary.
  • Manage and maintain internal and external data systems and provide technical assistance as needed
  • Manage the iWave donor research integration and train staff on utilizing the software as well as the custom screen and output sets available in Tessitura. On an annual basis, pull screening lists and execute screening updates.
  • Manage for data requests and technical support

Data Collection and Monitoring

  • Review and validate data entry across all data systems to ensure data entry is accurate, effective, and efficient
  • Develop and manage data collection processes and validation practices and procedures
  • Support in creating and use of data monitoring tools such as dashboards, flowcharts, presentation decks

Data Analysis and Reporting

  • Produce weekly and monthly outcome and performance indicator dashboards and weekly enrollment reports
  • Support program directors with completing outcome reports including reports for funders, internal reviews, and marketing materials
  • Assist with developing data visualizations and presentations for internal and external audiences, including graphs, tables, dashboards, etc. drawing on programmatic and secondary data sources
  • Support in the implementation, administration, and analysis of various evaluation tools such as surveys, focus groups, assessments

Date Development and Inquiry Support

  • Identify and support in gathering data sources, calculating baseline, setting targets, and benchmarks aligned to grant requirements
  • Provide coaching to program staff on the understanding of data reports and progress to meet goals
  • Support programming to develop a cycle of improvement through data coaching
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Degree in management information systems, finance, econometrics, statistics, or similar.
  • Minimum three years development experience or equivalent experience
  • Strong knowledge of Tessitura and database software
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Impeccable organizational and time management skills
  • Superior attention to detail
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to successfully interact with diverse groups of people
  • Creativity and flexibility
  • Professionalism in all settings
  • Display initiative and excellent judgment
  • Knowledge of classical music preferred
  • Ability to work occasional nights and weekends as required for concerts and events

H+H respects every individual's unique journey through life and will welcome personal statements which can deepen our understanding of any candidate's qualifying experiences. An equivalent combination of education and experience may satisfy these minimum qualifications. We appreciate all interest in this opportunity and look forward to responding to candidates whose experience most closely aligns with this position description.

Salary: $70000 - $80000 per year

Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Material Bank is a fast-paced, high-growth technology company and created the world's largest material marketplace for the Architecture and Design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to start and manage a design project. Learn more about us at www.materialbank.com or see below.

Material Bank is seeking a Product Data Analyst to expand and enhance our product catalog which powers several eCommerce platforms. As part of our experienced and collaborative Data Operations team, you will participate in building and maintaining the world’s largest product catalog focused on the Architect & Interior Design (A&D) community.

The ideal candidate will have a data background with experience updating and maintaining product catalogs. The team leverages AI & ML tools to streamline product onboarding and maintenance functions which requires associates who can comprehend what’s happening behind the scenes to troubleshoot complex issues and identify for optimization. It is critical that candidates are comfortable navigating, normalizing and organizing large data sets. This role requires an individual who is extremely detail-oriented, strategic in their approach, and comfortable with change in a dynamic work environment.

What you’ll do:


Import/export and synchronize data from multiple systems with accuracy
Create, manage and edit product listings within information databases
Seek, assess and resolve inconsistencies across large data sets
Partner with internal and external subject matter experts and data recipients
Extract and synthesize data from Brand websites and various online sources
Work at a quick pace with accuracy to resolve assigned tickets
Lead projects that challenge your capabilities and expand the reach of our team



What you’ll bring:


2-4 Years of proven data analyst or data entry work experience
Hunger to innovate, learn new systems and optimize data processes
Systematic thinker who adheres to a procedure-oriented environment
Proficiency in Excel, Product Info Mgmt (PIM) and time management
Competency in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Robotic Process Automation and/or Project Management
Swift analyzation and problem-solving skills
Meticulous attention to detail while maintaining speed and constant communication



What you’ll get from us:


Our people: If you thrive in an inclusive, innovative, and fast-paced organization, look no further! You will get to work alongside some of the brightest minds - Join a genuinely fun and supportive workplace where we keep our employees consistently engaged through internal communication and corporate events
Relaxation and Celebrations: Generous PTO, Sick Days, Paid National Holidays, and even more (ask us about this when we connect).
Health Benefits: We contribute to your medical, dental, vision and short-term/long-term disability plans and have a strong employee assistance program.
Plan for your Retirement: 401(k) eligible after your first 90 day's employed!
Giving Back: We sponsor multiple events throughout the year to help out our communities. You will receive time off to give back as well.
Growth: We’ll help you take your career to the next level. We want you to be creative and take initiative which will allow you to grow and create within the company. Most importantly, be the best at what matters!
Flexible Work Schedules: With business units and employees across the globe, Material Technologies has embraced a hybrid  working model allowing department leaders to decide on the best approach for their respective teams, whether that be remote, in person, or a little of both.



About Material Bank

Material Bank is the world’s largest material marketplace for the architecture and design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to search and sample materials. Material Bank connects design professionals to hundreds of manufacturers through facilitating brand discovery, rep engagement, and material sampling.

Material Bank has transformed the way an entire industry discovers and samples materials. By removing the friction that exists in the process, we drive business between architects and designers (members) and our Brand Partners (clients).

Our powerful material database and proprietary robotic distribution facility allow members to order samples until midnight (ET) to be delivered free of charge anywhere in the US, in one box, by 10:30 AM the next morning.

Connect with us and discover your career at Material Bank.

--

Material Bank is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or other status protected under any applicable federal, state or local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DataAnnotation is committed to creating quality AI. Join our team to help train AI chatbots while gaining the flexibility of remote work and choosing your own schedule.




We are looking for a proficient Data Analyst to join our team to train our AI chatbots. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.




In this role you will need to be proficient in at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, HTML, C++, C#, Swift and SQL) and able to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.




Benefits:




This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly, starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work




Responsibilities:




Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
Write high-quality answers and code snippets
Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance




Qualifications:




Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
Proficient in at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, HTML, C++, C#, Swift and SQL)
Excellent writing and grammar skills
A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)




Note: Data Annotation payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

Title: Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Description: Coordinates and participates in the planning, tracking, and/or execution of strategic and tactical intelligence operations. Focus on Financial intelligence and a range of macroeconomic and micro-economic issues as they relate to illicit financial networks and Geo-Political activities. Duties may include planning, coordinating, and ensuring quality control measures for a team of all-source analysts.Analyze threat information from multiple sources, disciplines, and agencies across the Intelligence Community. Duties include conducting studies to identify threats and trends; determining how these threats and trends effect national security; preparing reports through the aggregation of large amounts of intelligence information and presenting same into context and relevance. Qualifications – Conduct Counter-Intelligence assessments and support client HUMINT planning and support activities. – Identify and extract essential information from intelligence products and investigations, analyze the data, and synthesize the information into reports that can be disseminated. – Develop specific expertise, discern patterns of complex behavior, and provide an accurate understanding of present and future threats. – Apply highly developed inductive reasoning skills to provide a proactive approach to potential threats. – Navigate a variety of records, reports, miscellaneous communications, case files, and other sources to support research and analysis. – Initiate, establish, and maintain effective working relationships inside and outside the USG. #J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Codeworks is an IT Services firm headquartered in SE Wisconsin, known for our strong commitment to quality and for our direct client relationships.

We’re looking for an outstanding Data Analyst who has knowledge and passion about data in investment management domain and is committed to innovation and continuous improvement. As a part of the Data Operations Team, you will work in constructing and supporting a data first ecosystem and governance process. Partner closely with data owners, stewards and custodians in mapping out the data ecosystem and defining the appropriate governance model for each data domain.

Responsibilities

As a part of the Data Operations Team, you will work in constructing and supporting a data first ecosystem and governance process.

Partner closely with data owners, stewards and custodians in mapping out the data ecosystem and defining the appropriate governance model for each data domain.

Required Qualifications

Data experience; doesn't need to be an analyst or engineer but someone who has a history of solving data problems.

Investment management industry experience

Proficiency in SQL.

About Codeworks: Codeworks has over 25 years of experience serving Fortune 1000 companies in Wisconsin as well as our client's national locations. Our recruiting team excels at evaluating, advising, and connecting IT professionals with new opportunities that will satisfy their expectations regarding income and opportunity for growth. At Codeworks, we're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workforce and beyond. We believe in equal opportunities and value the unique perspectives that every individual brings to our team. Join us in creating an inclusive, innovative, and collaborative workplace where your talents can thrive.

Codeworks is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or national origin.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Remote!)
Description:
About Super.com

We started Super.com to help maximize lives–both the lives of our customers and the lives of our employees– so that everyone can experience all that life has to offer. For our employees, our promise is that Super.com is more than just a job; it’s an opportunity to unlock one’s potential, where learning is celebrated and impact is realized.

We are more than a fast-paced, high-growth tech company; we care about our people and take career progression seriously. This is your career and our aim is to supercharge it through the people, the work, and the programs that fuel who we are.

About This Team

As a Senior Data Analyst you will be reporting into a centralized Analytics & Data Science team designed to foster the data driven culture at Super.com. The multi-disciplinary team supports our travel vertical which specializes in hotel inventory distribution to end users. Our team operates at the intersection of data-driven decision-making and novel product development. We are dedicated to rapidly experimenting. The team is responsible for developing performant pricing strategies, optimizing acquisition channels, and evaluating marketing strategies aimed at attracting high-intent, quality users.

About This Role

We are seeking a skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Travel vertical. This new team member will work with travel-related data, such as: hotel inventory availability, price competitiveness, and customer journey flows within our mobile application and on our website. You will use data to confidently answer strategic questions and uncover insights about paid and organic traffic that will drive our business strategy and rapid growth. A major component of this role is data quality investigations, whereby you will query granular data to understand if our tracking plans are functioning as intended, particularly surrounding our native reinforcement learning pricing model.

A significant aspect of your role will be to uphold the integrity and accuracy of our data. You willl conduct detailed investigations using that data by querying information in its most granular state to verify the effectiveness of our tracking and analytics systems and recommend improvements. With your strong analytical skills in both SQL and Python, you will excel in quantitative analysis and confidently be able to translate your findings to business stakeholders.

This position offers a dynamic and impactful opportunity to assume ownership of your work as you conduct in-depth analyses to implement, debug, QA, and refine our data processes. You will work closely with our Travel leadership team to answer some of the company’s most urgent and impactful questions, and be exposed to rich data about the travel industry.

Responsibilites


Data-driven Culture: As an ambassador for our data-driven culture, you will leverage complex datasets to generate actionable insights that influence product strategy and drive results
Investigate Trends & Anomalies: With a keen eye for detail, you will investigate and analyze trends and anomalies in our pricing model data. This includes supporting debugging efforts and drilling down into data to uncover the root causes of changes in conversion rates and top-line financial metrics.
Data Management: you will access, clean and organize raw data in a way that makes sense for you, your team and your stakeholders
Business Understanding: you will determine the why behind our data-driven insights, and how the data both explains and impacts our business decisions. This includes analyzing how our various pricing strategies affect different customer segments and types of hotel properties. You will also be using these insights to formulate strategic recommendations



Preferred Experience


Advanced level proficiency in SQL and Python for data analytics
Experience with 1 or more dashboarding tools and comfortability with Git
Mentorship experience with a keen interest in teaching and peer reviewing work from other team members
3+ years of Experience working with data (as an Analyst, Scientist, or similar)
Strong technical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze and model a high volume of relational and potentially unstructured data
Experience working in a fast paced, high growth startup environment or the travel industry
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, capable of presenting data and insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences



Bonus Points


Proficiency with tools such as DBT, Amplitude, Snowflake and Looker
Ability to independently collaborate with business stakeholders and create data models designed to address specific questions and uncover valuable business insights
Bachelors in STEM and an advanced degree in Analytics, Data Science or equivalent



We've got you covered!


Competitive salary packages, equity options, great benefits from day one, wellness budgets, as well as personal and team-level development budgets
We are remote first – you have the flexibility to work from around the world and the hours that make sense for you– so that you can do your best work while living life on your own terms
Other perks include: unlimited PTO, recharge days, travel discounts on SuperTravel, Weekly UberEats credit and much more!
We welcome new family additions with generous parental leave and a flexible return-to-work plan
This is just scratching the surface– see our careers site for a more detailed overview of our perks & benefits



We Believe in Equal Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If needed, please notify our Talent Acquisition Partner.

As part of our compensation philosophy at Super.com we benchmark roles based on geographic location. The base salary range for this position is $80,000 USD - $165,000 USD

Title: Data Annotations Analyst, ADS RAMP
Description:
Description

We are hiring Data Associates for our peculiar data team! This role focuses on language data and customer facing experimental projects.

Key job responsibilities

In This Role, You Will


Work with team managers and project lead to support workloads
Provide support for data collection and project execution
Escalate blockers on predefined tasks
Highlight issues to leaders as required
Suggest improvements to operational inefficiencies that can be removed and existing procedures/SOPs to be enhanced via process creation or improvement


Location: 27 Melcher St, Boston, MA 02210 / (Amazon Building Code: BOS17)


This is an Onsite Role (5 days per week) – Offering commuter benefits (up to $260/month for public transportation or $190 for parking)
Pay: $23.90/hr


A day in the life

To be successful in this role, you will need to understand changes quickly in response to internal customers’ requests and changes in projects/worktypes accordingly. Driven by your passion for data, you show proactive behavior in raising issues with efficiency and accuracy. Your ability to concentrate and your high attention to details help you deliver high-quality work as well as maintaining strict confidentiality and follow all applicable Amazon policies for securing confidential information. Your excellent communication and strong organizational skills help you support several projects at one time, and re-prioritize as necessary, with the support of your leaders.

Basic Qualifications


Knowledge of Microsoft Office products and applications


Preferred Qualifications

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a motivated Analyst to join the talented Infectious, Niche, and Rare Diseases (INRD) team at DRG/Clarivate. The role comprises three broad functions: 1) market research and insight generation; 2) project management and execution; and 3) client service. The Analyst will translate therapeutic expertise and market research data into targeted insights for key decision-makers within the biopharmaceutical industry. Areas of coverage will span the team’s diverse research portfolio in infectious diseases as well as rare diseases spanning inflammatory, nervous system, hematology, and oncology indications.

About You


Advanced degree (MA, MBA, MPH, MS, or PhD in life sciences, social sciences or statistics) and/or relevant experience in the biopharma, healthcare, market research, consulting, or financial sectors.
2+ years relevant experience.
2 years minimum experience with MS products- Excel and Powerpoint especially


It would be great if you have...


Experience in modeling and forecasting pharmaceutical markets.
Experience with key information resources (e.g., clinical trial and pipeline databases, sales/consumption data, physician audit databases).
Experience with Tableau.
Experience with real-world data (e.g., claims, EHR).
Knowledge of market access and reimbursement issues in major and/or growth markets.


What You Will Be Doing In This Role


Build and apply an understanding of drug development and commercialization, including the dynamics in INRD markets.
Conduct primary research via interviews and surveys with medical and healthcare experts.
Critically analyze clinical data and commercial information from several sources to evaluate market trends, assess opportunity, and build market forecasts.
Effectively and concisely communicate business insights through multiple formats (e.g., slide decks, live presentations).
Develop and maintain partnerships with clients; understand their needs and deliver solutions.
Manage the execution of multiple projects with minimal supervision.
Field client queries and ad hoc requests with minimal supervision.
Show a strong grasp of complex commercial issues in communication with clients and internal stakeholders.


About The Team

The team consists of 12 members (3 US based) with expertise in market research on infectious, niche and rare diseases. The team handles the planning and oversight of syndicated market research reports in addition to custom reports created for a wide range of pharmaceutical clients.

Hours of Work  

Core business hours in eastern US time zone with the flexibility to support global clients in other time zones as needed.

This position can be performed hybrid in Toronto or Boston

Clarivate is an Equal Opportunity Employer Vets/Minorities/Women/Disabled

Title: Analyst I, Risk Analytics
Description:
We’re defining what it means to build and deliver the most extraordinary sports and entertainment experiences. Our global team is trailblazing new markets, developing cutting-edge products, and shaping the future of responsible gaming.

Here, “impossible” isn’t part of our vocabulary. You’ll face some of the toughest but most rewarding challenges of your career. They’re worth it. Channeling your inner grit will accelerate your growth, help us win as a team, and create unforgettable moments for our customers.

The Crown Is Yours

As an Associate Analyst, Risk, you will heavily support fraud operations management through the use of data and analytics in order to assess the effectiveness and efficiency of our agents. Risk Analytics works to prevent account takeovers, identify stolen credit cards used on the DraftKings platform, to identify and prevent check kiting, and more. You will lean in on supporting fraud incident responses by assessing data and finding signals to better detect new threats. Through cross-functional collaboration and analytical problem solving, you will enable teams across our organization to make smarter, better, and faster decisions.

What you’ll do as an Associate Analyst, Risk


Analyze data to support data-driven decision-making. For example: optimize risk thresholds, evaluate alert performance, and interpret trends while collaborating with team members and senior leadership to ensure effective risk management.
Build and maintain a reporting suite to support critical initiatives and inform stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineering to stitch various disparate data sources together, enhancing insights across the entire risk department.
Dive into databases, CRMs, and bespoke internal tooling to understand and explain how DraftKings systems holistically interact.
Drive process improvements through data powered recommendations.
React real-time to various threats to the business by evaluating alerts, assessing capacity and priorities, and delivering recommendations to drive value.
Create high-quality communications to align key stakeholders across the business.
Work cross-functionally to analyze and highlight important customer behaviors.



What you’ll bring


At least 1 year of professional analytics experience.
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Finance, or a related field preferred.
An analytical mindset and experience with analyzing and interpreting large data sets.
Experience in data manipulation required, such as SQL, python, R, etc.
Experience in data visualization (Tableau) required.
Experience building simple frameworks and finding solutions to complex problems.
Demonstrated ability to create and deliver compelling, data driven presentations.
Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, ever changing environment.



Join Our Team

We’re a publicly traded (NASDAQ: DKNG) technology company headquartered in Boston. As a regulated gaming company, you may be required to obtain a gaming license issued by the appropriate state agency as a condition of employment. Don’t worry, we’ll guide you through the process if this is relevant to your role.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $62,400.00 - $93,600.00, plus bonus, equity, and benefits as applicable. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range and how that was determined during the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst II, Marlborough, Full-Time, Hybrid
Description:
Schedule

Mon - Fri: 8 AM - 5 PM (40 Hours)

What You’ll Do


Gather and analyze data in support of business cases and proposed projects
Create and maintain business intelligence reports and delivery systems and create, maintain, and enhance regular reporting deliverables in Tableau
Proactively analyze data from a variety of sources to inform decision making
Scrub data to ensure accuracy of reporting
Quickly and accurately deliver applications and analysis, constantly exceeding customer expectations
Develop insight to data, review findings with business partners, and provide superb customer service through clear and concise communications as well as complete documentation
Perform other job-related duties as assigned by Manager(s)


What You’ll Need


Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field
Minimum of 3 years of professional data analysis
Minimum of 1 years of experience in Financial Services preferably Banking
Advanced data visualization design techniques using Tableau
Experience in an AWS cloud-based analytic ecosystem preferred
Knowledge of Advanced SQL, RDMS, and MPP Databases
Knowledge of database management tools such as DBeaver and Microsoft’s SSMS
Knowledge of analytic approaches and methods (reporting, modeling, optimization)
Strong data analysis & business skills
Working knowledge of Agile Methodology preferred


What We Do

DCU is the largest credit union headquartered in New England – serving more than one million members in all 50 states. With over 1,900 team members, we strive to make DCU a great place to work with an excellent work-life balance, and a community that cares.

We are proud to be a Equal Opportunity Employer/ Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Science
Description:
Business Overview

Mediahub is one of the three major global media agencies within IPG Mediabrands with over 1000+ employees worldwide. We are an award-winning agency built for brands who are challenging and disrupting the status quo. Our organization is focused on challenging all facets of media in an environment of rapid change in order maximize our clients’ investments. We are challenging key fundamentals in the areas of audience creation, purpose, creativity, and digital platforms.

Named Media Agency of the Year by Adweek, Ad Age, and Campaign, Mediahub is powered by the buying and intelligence power of Magna Global and the data backbone of Acxiom.




Position Summary

The Senior Analyst, Data Science brings advanced analytical skills and data expertise to the organization, enabling Mediahub to leverage data-driven insights, optimize campaign performance, measure ROI, understand the target audience, and help clients stay ahead of industry trends. The Sr. Analyst will be responsible for leading quantitative model development and refreshment, synthesizing insights from modeling, and providing optimization recommendations across several client engagements. This role will be exposed to offline and online advertising, consumer insights, survey analysis, and market/audience segmentation.




Responsibilities

Work efficiently with clients and analytics partners to define, extract, and synthesize available data and share results and insight with Mediahub team members.
Maintain and upgrade existing predictive models to evaluate media efficacy and effectiveness, willing to develop new models to help answer business questions.
Glean actionable insights to support in-market campaign optimization.
Perform statistical analysis of primary and syndicated research, media spend and allocation, and business performance data.
Support proactive “what-if” analysis and guide marketing and advertising decision-making.
Analyze scenarios to assess the before/after impacts of target market selection, media choice and allocation on client's business performance.
Package and present analytical findings and communicate (both written and verbal) complex concepts to Sr. Client teams and internal teams.
Contribute to the specifications and design of models, including mentoring analysts on appropriate tools and techniques for given situations.




Required Skills & Experience

Must have advanced knowledge and application of data extraction and statistical software such as SAS, R, Python, SQL, Microsoft Excel, and/ or others.
Must be able to provide high-quality analytical skills under tight, constantly shifting deadlines.
Mediahub does not require candidates to have a college degree




Desired Skills & Experience

Master’s degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Business, Marketing, or other quantitative discipline preferred
1-3+ years of work experience in a professional services environment: management consulting, market research, advertising, statistical modeling or interactive/technology consulting.
1-3+ years of advanced statistical analysis in a marketing/advertising environment, including but not limited to cluster analysis, media mix modeling and optimization, predictive analytics, and experimental design.
Familiarity with statistical modeling, direct/ digital marketing test designs, and audience segmentation.
Attention to detail and time management to deliver high quality work for multiple projects across several client engagements while meeting deadlines.
Balances desire for quantitative rigor with realities of inconsistent business data.
Must be able to provide high-quality analytical skills under tight, constantly shifting deadlines




We See You

At IPG Mediabrands, we are unified behind a commitment to fostering a culture of inclusion and belonging. Together, we shine through a set of shared values and behaviors. We take pride in our responsibility to our clients, communities, and to each other. We embrace differences and recognize the unique value that each of us brings to our community.

We encourage you to apply, as unique backgrounds, perspectives, and lived experiences are welcomed.

We See You at IPG Mediabrands.




Wage and Benefits

We offer a Total Rewards package that includes medical and dental coverage, 401(k) plans, flex spending, life insurance, disability, employee discount program, employee stock purchase program and paid family benefits to support you and your family. To give you the ability to better meet your personal needs, and in support of your physical and emotional well-being, you will receive discretionary time off days and company-wide Appreciation Weeks and Wellness Days.

We also offer a competitive Total Compensation package, including a competitive salary and eligibility for an annual discretionary incentive award or a relevant incentive award.

The salary range for this position is posted below. Where an employee or prospective employee is paid within this range will depend on, among other factors, actual ranges for current/former employees in the subject position, market considerations, budgetary considerations, tenure and standing with the Company (applicable to current employees), as well as the employee’s/applicant’s skill set, level of experience, and qualifications.




Employment Transparency

It is the policy of Mediabrands, division of the Interpublic group, to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, creed, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, veteran status, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

The employer will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the American with Disabilities Act of 1990. The job description will be reviewed periodically as duties and responsibilities change with business necessity. Essential and other job functions are subject to modification. Reasonable accommodations may be provided to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

For applicants to jobs in the United States: In compliance with the current Americans with Disabilities Act and state and local laws, if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation to apply for a position with Mediabrands, please email accommodation@mbww.com.




About IPG Mediabrands

IPG Mediabrands is the media and marketing solutions division of Interpublic Group (NYSE: IPG). IPG Mediabrands manages over $47 billion in marketing investment globally on behalf of its clients across its full-service agency networks UM, Initiative and Mediahub and through its award-winning specialty business units Healix, Kinesso, MAGNA, Mediabrands Content Studio, Orion Holdings, Rapport, and the IPG Media Lab. IPG Mediabrands clients include many of the world’s most recognizable and iconic brands from a broad portfolio of industry sectors including automotive, personal finance, consumer product goods (CPG), pharma, health and wellness, entertainment, financial services, energy, toys and gaming, direct to consumer and e-commerce, retail, hospitality, food and beverage, fashion and beauty. The company employs more than 18,000 diverse marketing communication professionals in more than 130 countries. Learn more at www.ipgmediabrands.com.

Title: Data Conversion Analyst
Company: Galen Healthcare Solutions, an RLDatix company
Description:
About Us: Galen Healthcare Solutions, an RLDatix company, is a healthcare IT software and services organization. As a company, we are honored to have our Technical and Professional Services groups ranked #1 in KLAS by our clients, including winning 2021’s coveted Top Overall IT Services Firm award. Additionally, we have received recognition from Modern Healthcare, appearing on their Best Places to Work list for the past 10+years. About You: Galen Healthcare is searching for a data conversion analyst to assist healthcare organizations as they transition to Epic. In this role, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with both clinical and technical audiences in a fast-paced and challenging environment. We support our clients by identifying and extracting key clinical data that providers need to provide continuity of care when they transition to a new EHR. You will work as part of a team that is responsible for extracting data from previous EHRs (and ancillary healthcare IT systems), mapping and transforming the data into new formats, importing the data into their new EHRs, and then perform multiple rounds of validation.This position r equires experience working in healthcare IT, especially experience working with Epic. Epic certification is preferred. Responsibilities : Build strong relationships with your clientsand coworkers Communicate effectively with both technical and clinical audiences Manage multiple projects, across a wide array of clients Analyze client requirements, implementing the desired solutions and using your judgment to recommend alternatives when appropriate Perform clinical translations that translate legacy terminology to Epic category lists or materfiles Master working with different clinical elements from allergies, medications, and problems to notes, scans, and vital signs Follow clients’ change control processes Maintain data integrity through paying close attention to detail and following our methodology that supports multiple rounds of testing and validation Requirements : Experience implementing or supporting Epic, preferably in an analyst role for at least one year Desire to learn Exceptional communication skills Analytical & Troubleshooting skills Comfortable using Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word) Other : Experience: 1-3 years professional experience Education: Bachelor’s degree Applicants must be a U.S. Resident or currently able to legally work in the U.S Work Location and Schedule Requirements: This position is 100% remote. Work from home requirements are: Ability to work independently and efficiently from a home office environment High Speed Internet Service It is a requirement that employees work in a distraction free workplace Galen Benefit Highlights: Health and Dental Insurance, 401(k) with employer match, paid time off, Employee Assistance Program, Flexible Spending Accounts, annual company trip plus much more #J-18808-Ljbffr

In this role, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with both clinical and technical audiences in a fast-paced and challenging environment. We support our clients by identifying and extracting key clinical data that providers need to provide continuity of care when they transition to a new EHR. You will work as part of a team that is responsible for extracting data from previous EHRs (and ancillary healthcare IT systems), mapping and transforming the data into new formats, importing the data into their new EHRs, and then perform multiple rounds of validation.This position r equires experience working in healthcare IT, especially experience working with Epic. Epic certification is preferred. Responsibilities : Build strong relationships with your clientsand coworkers Communicate effectively with both technical and clinical audiences Manage multiple projects, across a wide array of clients Analyze client requirements, implementing the desired solutions and using your judgment to recommend alternatives when appropriate Perform clinical translations that translate legacy terminology to Epic category lists or materfiles Master working with different clinical elements from allergies, medications, and problems to notes, scans, and vital signs Follow clients’ change control processes Maintain data integrity through paying close attention to detail and following our methodology that supports multiple rounds of testing and validation Requirements : Experience implementing or supporting Epic, preferably in an analyst role for at least one year Desire to learn Exceptional communication skills Analytical & Troubleshooting skills Comfortable using Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word) Other : Experience: 1-3 years professional experience Education: Bachelor’s degree Applicants must be a U.S. Resident or currently able to legally work in the U.S Work Location and Schedule Requirements: This position is 100% remote. Work from home requirements are: Ability to work independently and efficiently from a home office environment High Speed Internet Service It is a requirement that employees work in a distraction free workplace Galen Benefit Highlights: Health and Dental Insurance, 401(k) with employer match, paid time off, Employee Assistance Program, Flexible Spending Accounts, annual company trip plus much more #J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Remote




Stay updated on all our exciting job openings! Visit our website to create personalized job alerts tailored to your preferences: https://overturepartners.com/it-jobs




Overture Partners' client has an immediate need for a Senior Data Analyst. To secure an interview for this role, candidates must meet the following criteria:




Must Haves:

SQL, SAS, Python
Data Mapping
Data Mart Logic
Health insurance experience is a plus, but not required




What Client Needs you to do:




Seeking a senior data resource for an internal platform transformation Responsibilities include data field mapping, gap analysis, and rebuilding the datamart. This hands-on role requires SQL, SAS, and preferably Python skills. The individual should be analytical, independent, and adept at data logic. This is a business-side role with technical partners handling the building.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or other factors protected by federal, state, and/or local law.
